This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made..... Realistic. Movies were not candy coated during the late 60s and early 70s. They were very "in touch" with what was going on because of how violent and divided America was. Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the countryside, the ideals he intensively pursued before his unexpected death, the tremendous chaos and angst in the world after World War II, and the discord that continues to have a powerful influence on humankind even in today’s modern era.<|end_of_text|>

"Les Valseuses" was remade as "My Own Private Idaho" by Gus Van Sant, according to Wikipedia. And, this Australian couple's monologue in the beginning reminds me of the same thing I enjoy the most with the "My Breakfast with Blassie" interviews of the same

If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John Carroll, Eric Campbell, and George J. Lewis, Saved by the Badman is sure to provide a brilliant cowboy movie experience.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, left to fend for itself when its owners move away, has taken to killing the local food supply, endangering all animals and humans in its path. With the help of local activist and animal lover (Karen Allen), the son must get the town to see that the cat is the animal’s friend
